intro: Gonocarpus halconensis, commonly known as the Halcon Island nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the island of Halcon in the Philippines. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
